How to Install tree-puzzle on debian

  • Home
  • debian
  • tree-puzzle

Today in this tutorial, I’ll show you how you can install tree-puzzle on debian with and without using the command line.

Introduction

Installing tree-puzzle on debian is very easy. And with the help of this tutorial, you will be able to easily install, update and uninstall tree-puzzle in just a few steps.

In this tutorial I’ll show you four methods to install tree-puzzle, the methods are using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic. All these methods require you to have an active and stable internet connection and sudo permission.

Install tree-puzzle Using apt

To install tree-puzzle in debian using apt, you will need to run the apt update command first to get the updated list of packages from the repositories.

Copy the command given below and paste it in the command line, then press enter. If you are using the sudo command for the first time then you might also need to enter your root password.

sudo apt update

After you have updated the package list using apt, you can now install tree-puzzle using the apt install command. To do that use the command given below.

sudo apt -y install tree-puzzle

The installation of tree-puzzle might take a little bit of time depending upon your internet connection and machine configuration.

Install tree-puzzle Using apt-get

To install tree-puzzle using apt-get in debian, you will need to first update the package list using the apt-get update command. Copy, paste, and enter the command given below in the command line.

sudo apt-get update

After updating the package lists, use the apt-get install command given below to install tree-puzzle.

sudo apt-get -y install tree-puzzle

Install tree-puzzle Using Synaptic

To install tree-puzzle using Synaptic you will need to first install Synaptic, you can do that by following the instructions from here. After installing synaptic follow the steps below to install tree-puzzle on your debian using Synaptic.

You can open synaptic by clicking on the menu icon then searching for synaptic or you can open the command line and enter the command given below –

sudo synaptic

After synaptic opens, click on the search icon and search for tree-puzzle. This will display the tree-puzzle package in the package window, now to install tree-puzzle, click on the checkbox that is on the left side.

Then click on Mark for Installation, this will select the tree-puzzle package for installation, now to install it click on the Apply button, you will get a summary window where click on the apply button again to start the download of tree-puzzle.

If the download and installation are successful then the checkmark option will turn green.

Install tree-puzzle Using aptitude

To install tree-puzzle on debian using aptitude, you will need to first install Aptitude in your debian. To install Aptitude follow the instructions here. Once you have aptitude installed proceed to the installation of tree-puzzle.

Now you will need to first update your package lists from the repositories, use the apt update command for that, after that update the package list of aptitude using the aptitude update command.

sudo apt update sudo aptitude update

After updating the package list of aptitude, install tree-puzzle using the command aptitude install tree-puzzle.

sudo aptitude -y install tree-puzzle

How to Upgrade tree-puzzle on debian

If you want to upgrade the tree-puzzle package on your debian to its latest version then here’s how you can do that using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic.

Upgrade tree-puzzle using Apt & Apt-get

To upgrade tree-puzzle to its latest version using apt or apt-get, you will need to open the terminal then run the sudo apt update command to update the package list, after that copy and paste the commands given below to upgrade tree-puzzle.

sudo apt install --only-upgrade tree-puzzle sudo apt-get install --only-upgrade tree-puzzle

Upgrade tree-puzzle using Aptitude

To upgrade tree-puzzle using aptitude you will need to again run the update command to update the package list, use command sudo aptitude update to do that. After that run the command given below to upgrade tree-puzzle.

sudo aptitude -y full-upgrade tree-puzzle

Upgrade tree-puzzle using Synaptic

To upgrade tree-puzzle using synaptic open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or by going to the menu and searching for synaptic.

In synaptic click on the reload button, this will look for updates. After that you will need to search for tree-puzzle, now right-click tree-puzzle, and click on the mark for upgrade option.

Now to upgrade tree-puzzle just click on the apply button, then click on the apply button again in the summary screen.

How To Uninstall tree-puzzle on debian

If you want to remove and uninstall tree-puzzle from your debian then here’s how you can do that. To remove just tree-puzzle, you can use the command that is given below, copy the command, paste it in the command line then press enter.

sudo apt remove tree-puzzle

Remove related packages, dependencies & configuration files of tree-puzzle

To remove all the related packages, dependencies and configuration files of tree-puzzle you can use the command given below.

sudo apt -y purge tree-puzzle

Remove tree-puzzle using Synaptic Package Manager

You can also uninstall tree-puzzle using the synaptic package manager, first open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or search and open it directly.

After that in synaptic search for tree-puzzle, right-click the tree-puzzle package and click on the Mark for Complete Removal option. Now to uninstall tree-puzzle click on the apply button then in summary click on apply again.

Conclusion

That is how you can install tree-puzzle on debian using the command line or using the synaptic package manager. I also showed you how you can uninstall and upgrade tree-puzzle using the command line or using the synaptic package manager.

If you need any help regarding the installation of tree-puzzle then send me a mail at netmikoblog@gmail.com, thank you.
